          Tutorial: mojo

          The mojo project provides a core data structure called NDBuffer, which is a non-owning, multi-dimensional view into a block of memory, similar to a tensor. It’s designed for high-performance computing by allowing direct memory manipulation via UnsafePointers and supporting efficient element access through Strides and Offset Computation. NDBuffer can handle both statically known and dynamically determined dimension sizes using DimList and Dim abstractions, and it facilitates SIMD Data Access for accelerated, vectorized operations on data.

          Source Repository: None
